summary: This is an email chain from October 19, 2020, discussing logistical challenges in meeting a discovery deadline for the Epstein/Maxwell case. The correspondence involves coordination between US Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff regarding copy-making, reviewer timelines, and resource allocation.

events.title: Internal Review Deadline for Epstein/Maxwell Discovery
events.description: The prosecution team is asking reviewers to finish their work by this date to allow time for responsiveness coding and copying before the formal discovery production deadline.

events.title: Formal Discovery Production Deadline
events.description: The official deadline for producing discovery materials in the Epstein/Maxwell case.

keyFacts: The document reveals internal prosecution team stress and logistical hurdles in preparing discovery for the Epstein/Maxwell case as of October 2020.
A CART analyst specifically assigned to the Epstein/Maxwell case was noted as being out of the office, creating a bottleneck for making copies of materials.
There was an initial expectation that the FBI would handle copying, but they reportedly 'backed out,' shifting the task to the US Attorney's Office (SDNY).
The team was concerned that if document reviewers did not begin work immediately, they would not have enough time to complete the review, coding, and copying by the deadlines.
The correspondence highlights the scale of the discovery process, noting it was monopolizing many office resources.
